channel.title: Comments on: Run Microsoft Windows Server And SQL Server in the cloud on Amazon EC2
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Natas
item.dc:creator: Natas
item.description: Very very interesting, I wonder if it is replicated or not. This is great if they handle or that stuff, this way you don't have to have an active passive cluster or do database mirroring or replication or log shipping
item.content:encoded: Very very interesting, I wonder if it is replicated or not. This is great if they handle or that stuff, this way you don’t have to have an active passive cluster or do database mirroring or replication or log shipping

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Yes in that case crummyness would become crummyless
item.content:encoded: Yes in that case crummyness would become crummyless

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: True, wouldn't want the world to go 9 hours without crummyness ;)

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Make sense, as long as they can stay up and don't experience another 9 hour outage
item.content:encoded: Make sense, as long as they can stay up and don’t experience another 9 hour outage

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: This looks pretty cool. If its' not too much more than regular shared hosting I might try running crummy web page on there when its' available.
item.content:encoded: This looks pretty cool. If its’ not too much more than regular shared hosting I might try running crummy web page on there when its’ available.
